page.title: 10EDUCATION
page.content: Until 1957 the CofE school was all age(5-15),but since then it has become a junior&infant C.P school(5-11) with an average of 80 children on roll. At 11 the children go to Looe Comprehensive,thereafter(for those who wish it)to a 6th form college at Liskeard ora College of Further Education at St Austell. In 1984 the first phase of a new school was completed housing 1 class.2 other classes are situated in temporary huts.The staff consists of a teaching head,2 assistants and a part time teacher.An ancillary is employed to help with children with problems. At present the school is helping to develop a scheme of cooperation among 6 small schools in an attempt to broaden the curriculum. There is no provision for nursery education,but there is a playgroup.
